column5: Hi Guys. Just wanna get your thoughts on the Pflueger Patriarch magnesium reel. Has anyone ever fished one before? Is it worth the 2 bills they want for one. Im about to buy one and just wanted your thoughts on the reel.
If it is as reliable as the President, and, the Arbor (still can't believe how much I love that reel) I'd say yes.  I guess the question is how does it stack up against the Shimano Stradic CI4.
if you are willing to spent that kind of money, then you should look at the Daiwa or Shimano reel.

I am looking at a new rod/reel now as well, I was thinking of a shimano crucial and stradic 2500FI, i would be willing to spend more, it's just tough to know where diminishing returns makes it not worth the cost.
Here is a good read on the pflueger patriarch  pflueger patriarch review

Since were on the subject i am wondering what is the fuctional difference between a shimano crucial labelled as a drop shot rod vs one that isn't, i like the handle design on the drop shot models more.
I have a Pflueger Patriarch. Love the reel it's so light. no complaints yet. I think it's worth the 2 bills.
i heard the patriarch was an incredible reel but i opted for the stradic CI4 because shimano's warranty has such a good reputation on OFC.

X2. I played around with the patriarch at the store, and it looked like an awesome reel. Super light and well built. I went with the CI4 for the same reason above.  So far I have not been disappointed.

i liked the drag better on the Patriarch vs the Ci4 and it is lighter than the ci4,   Patriarch comes with a spare spool if that matters to you Ci4 does not.  I think the reel is to new to give a quality review on its durability but i'm yet to hear anythng bad about them .  I own Ci4's though lol tough to beat a shimano
I have an idea of of where a combo like that is on the bottom of Lake St. Clair... whoops!  I GPSd the area but no luck yet.
